segments.content: Hi everyone!
segments.sourceMdx: Hi everyone!

segments.content: This week I'm excited about a promising new headless component library, and I've found various interesting articles about Web Components relevant to React developers.
segments.sourceMdx: This week I'm excited about a promising new headless component library, and I've found various interesting articles about Web Components relevant to React developers.

segments.content: On the mobile side, Google introduced Android XR and React Native support is already coming!
segments.sourceMdx: On the mobile side, Google introduced Android XR and React Native support is already coming!

segments.content: Iâ€™m usually not into UI libs. But when Radix, MUI and Floating UI creators gather to create a new set of 25 unstyled, accessible, composable primitive components with great care to details, I think itâ€™s worth paying attention! Radix is super popular these days (notably thanks to shadcn/ui), but has been [less actively maintained](https://github.com/radix-ui/primitives/graphs/contributors) recently, and a new headless lib challenger is always welcome!
segments.sourceMdx: Iâ€™m usually not into UI libs. But when Radix, MUI and Floating UI creators gather to create a new set of 25 unstyled, accessible, composable primitive components with great care to details, I think itâ€™s worth paying attention\! Radix is super popular these days (notably thanks to shadcn/ui), but has been [less actively maintained](https://github.com/radix-ui/primitives/graphs/contributors) recently, and a new headless lib challenger is always welcome\!

segments.content: **React 19 and Custom Elements**
segments.sourceMdx: **React 19 and Custom Elements**

segments.content: Various related articles I found interesting:
segments.sourceMdx: Various related articles I found interesting:

segments.content:
* ğŸ“œ [React 19 and Web Component Examples](https://frontendmasters.com/blog/react-19-and-web-component-examples/): Chris Coyier testing React 19 custom elements support by creating a Lit element and rendering it though JSX. You can seamlessly pass an object as props, but for event handlers you may need to dispatch a custom event.
* ğŸ“œ [React 19 introduces full support for custom elements](https://aleks-elkin.github.io/posts/2024-12-06-react-19/): Comparing support improvement between React 18 and React 19.
* ğŸ“œ [Sweet Suspense](https://plainvanillaweb.com/blog/articles/2024-09-09-sweet-suspense/): Fun experiment recreating React lazy/Suspense/ErrorBoundary with custom elements.
* ğŸ“œ [Isomorphic Web Components](https://jakelazaroff.com/words/isomorphic-web-components/): Not using React, but a useful overview of server-side rendering support for Web components.
segments.sourceMdx:
- ğŸ“œ [React 19 and Web Component Examples](https://frontendmasters.com/blog/react-19-and-web-component-examples/): Chris Coyier testing React 19 custom elements support by creating a Lit element and rendering it though JSX. You can seamlessly pass an object as props, but for event handlers you may need to dispatch a custom event.
- ğŸ“œ [React 19 introduces full support for custom elements](https://aleks-elkin.github.io/posts/2024-12-06-react-19/): Comparing support improvement between React 18 and React 19\.
- ğŸ“œ [Sweet Suspense](https://plainvanillaweb.com/blog/articles/2024-09-09-sweet-suspense/): Fun experiment recreating React lazy/Suspense/ErrorBoundary with custom elements.
- ğŸ“œ [Isomorphic Web Components](https://jakelazaroff.com/words/isomorphic-web-components/): Not using React, but a useful overview of server-side rendering support for Web components.

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [React Bricks â€“ the Visual CMS for React got more accessible with lower entry price and flexible pay-as-you-go options. Start for free!](https://www.reactbricks.com/?utm_source=twir\&utm_campaign=ql24)
* ğŸ¦ [Lee Robinson explains why transitioning between pages when running Next.js locally take time](https://x.com/leeerob/status/1869095675201192335)
* ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR - `unstable_rootParams()`](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/72837): A new convenient experimental API to return path params from all path segments up to the root layout. Looks particularly useful for accessing a i18n `[locale]` param.
* ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR - `experimental.newDevOverlay`](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/73977): A new dev overlay is coming and the feature flag already exists.
* ğŸ‘€ [Rsbuild PR - plugin-react-router](https://github.com/web-infra-dev/rsbuild/pull/4186): React Router framework features (Remix) are now implemented as a Vite plugin, but it seems other bundlers could also turn React Router into a framework ğŸ˜²
* ğŸ„ [GitHub Unwrapped 2024](https://githubunwrapped.com/): The Remotion-based project has just been update for 2024.
* ğŸ“œ [How to validate your React i18next application](https://lingual.dev/blog/how-to-validate-your-react-i18next-application/): Present a workflow based on react-i18next to prevent missing, unused, and invalid translation keys. Thereâ€™s another post for react-intl users.
* ğŸ“œ [Rails + Stimulus + React - The definitive way to integrate](https://blog.codeminer42.com/rails-stimulus-react/): Using Stimulus data attributes to mount a React autocomplete component on a Rails page.
* ğŸ“œ [Build-time Open Graph Images in Remix](https://kettanaito.com/blog/build-time-og-images-in-remix): Explains limits of Satori, and introduces a new remix-og-image Vite plugin that spawns a Chromium instance.
* ğŸ“œ [5 tips to effectively optimize INP in React](https://calendar.perfplanet.com/2024/5-tips-to-effectively-optimize-inp-in-react/): Reduce DOM size, split components, use Suspense, avoid hydration errors, pay attention to useEffect that can be synchronous.
* ğŸ“œ [You might not need a React Form Library](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-form-validation/): Shows how to validate forms server-side and client-side without a library.
* ğŸ“œ [Introducing TanStack Start](https://frontendmasters.com/blog/introducing-tanstack-start/)
* ğŸ“œ [React Tech Stack for 2025](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-tech-stack/)
* ğŸ“œ [Sharing Types and Code Between the Server and Client](https://echobind.com/post/sharing-types-and-code-between-the-server-and-client)
* ğŸ“œ [Storybook tags - Organize your components and stories to match the way you work](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-tags/)
* ğŸ“œ [The Mental Model of Server Components](https://saewitz.com/the-mental-model-of-server-components)
* ğŸ“œ [How to Dockerize a React App](https://www.docker.com/blog/how-to-dockerize-react-app/)
* ğŸ“¦ [Inertia 2.0 - Redefining Frontend Development for Laravel](https://blog.laravel.com/announcing-inertia-20-redefining-frontend-development-for-laravel): New major version of this tool that seamlessly integrates React into PHP backends. New features: async requests, deferred props, prefetching, polling.
* ğŸ“¦ [Apollo Client 3.12 - GraphQL fragment data masking](https://www.apollographql.com/blog/more-resilient-code-with-data-masking-in-apollo-client-3-12): Similar to Relay, Apollo Client improves in colocation, encapsulation, and performance. A component will only receive the fields it needs, and nothing more.
* ğŸ“¦ [Virtua 0.39 - Zero-config, fast and small virtual list - React 19 support](https://github.com/inokawa/virtua)
* ğŸ“¦ [Material UI EoY update - MUI v5/6 are compatible with React 19](https://mui.com/blog/material-ui-2024-updates/)
* ğŸ“¦ [Roadmap UI - Composable components for building interactive roadmaps - Gantt, Kanban, Calendar, List, Table](https://www.roadmap-ui.com/)
* ğŸ¥ [Justin Poli - What happens when you break the rules of React?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NsFD-1HkJNU): Mobx-State-Tree maintainer explains plan to make the reactive library compatible with the React Compiler.
* ğŸ¥ [Wawa Sensei - My Journey Coding a VR/AR Rhythm Game with Three.js & React Three Fiber](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jBh4ftHqC5U)
* ğŸ¥ [Theo - Astro stole my favorite parts of Next (and I'm hyped)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3xqa0SsRbdM)
* ğŸ¥ [Shruti Kapoor - React 19: The Features You Actually Want](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hek-Ux9jha8)
